Name: FileFlows
Overview:
FileFlows lets you process files in a rule flow like system.  
  Primary focus is for video file processing, including coverting videos to standard format (hevc/ac3 etc), and other function for example, removing black bars from videos, adding chapter points for comskip/edl files and many more features
  It supports a Server and mutliple node setup, where you can have one server (with an internal processing node) and additional computers/machines as additional processing nodes.
  For NVIDIA GPU setup see https://github.com/revenz/FileFlows/wiki/Unraid-NVIDIA-Setup

@attributes.Name: TimeZone
@attributes.Description: TimeZone for the container refer to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones for a list of possible timezones

@attributes.Name: WebUI
@attributes.Description: Port used to access the WebUI.  The container uses port 5000 this can forward any port to that in the container.

@attributes.Name: Data
@attributes.Description: Location of the database file, best to set this in appdata

@attributes.Name: Logs
@attributes.Description: logging directory, best to store this with the appdata

@attributes.Name: Temp Directory
@attributes.Description:
Where temporary files will be created during the file flow process
Best to put this on a cache drive or a faster ssd/nvme

@attributes.Name: /media/
@attributes.Description: Mapping to a folder in unRAID.   this is optional and you can add as many as you like.

@attributes.Name: NVIDIA_VISIBLE_DEVICES
@attributes.Description: If you have multiple NVIDIA GPUs set a specific ID from the settings page
